key_points: The WHO, supported by SAGE, reviews evidence on booster doses for COVID-19 vaccines
Current statement reflects understanding as of 7 December 2021, particularly in the context of the Omicron variant
Booster doses aim to restore vaccine effectiveness after it has diminished over time
WHO Director-General called for a moratorium on booster doses for healthy adults until the end of 2021 to improve global vaccine equity
Vaccine booster decisions should consider individual and public health benefits and global vaccine access equity
Primary global health goal is to reduce COVID-19 deaths and severe disease, protect health systems
Emerging data show a decline in vaccine effectiveness against SARS-CoV-2 infection and COVID-19 over time, more so in older adults
Vaccine effectiveness against severe COVID-19 decreased by about 8% over a period of 6 months in all age groups
WHO recommends an additional dose for certain inactivated vaccines for those aged 60 and over as part of the primary series
Booster vaccinations show strong immunological response, with studies indicating improved protection against infection and severe disease
